trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR</codeph> system procedure replaces a jar file in a database.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR</codeph> system procedure replaces a jar file in a database.

target.mrk: The <codeph>SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR</codeph> system procedure replaces a jar file in a database.

trans-unit.source: SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR(IN JAR_FILE_PATH_OR_URL VARCHAR(32672), IN QUALIFIED_JAR_NAME VARCHAR(32672))

seg-source.mrk: SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR(IN JAR_FILE_PATH_OR_URL VARCHAR(32672), IN QUALIFIED_JAR_NAME VARCHAR(32672))

target.mrk: SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR(IN JAR_FILE_PATH_OR_URL VARCHAR(32672), IN QUALIFIED_JAR_NAME VARCHAR(32672))

trans-unit.source: The path or URL of the jar file to use as a replacement. A path includes both the directory and the file name (unless the file is in the current directory, in which case the directory is optional). For example:

seg-source.mrk: The path or URL of the jar file to use as a replacement.
A path includes both the directory and the file name (unless the file is in the current directory, in which case the directory is optional).

target.mrk: The path or URL of the jar file to use as a replacement.
A path includes both the directory and the file name (unless the file is in the current directory, in which case the directory is optional).

trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> name of the jar file, qualified by the schema name. Two examples:

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> name of the jar file, qualified by the schema name.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> name of the jar file, qualified by the schema name.

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default. See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

target.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

trans-unit.source: -- SQL statement CALL sqlj.replace_jar('c:\myjarfiles\newtours.jar', 'APP.Sample1') -- SQL statement -- replace jar from remote location CALL SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR('http://www.example.com/tours.jar', 'APP.Sample2')

seg-source.mrk: -- SQL statement CALL sqlj.replace_jar('c:\myjarfiles\newtours.jar', 'APP.Sample1') -- SQL statement -- replace jar from remote location CALL SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR('http://www.example.com/tours.jar', 'APP.Sample2')

target.mrk: -- SQL statement CALL sqlj.replace_jar('c:\myjarfiles\newtours.jar', 'APP.Sample1') -- SQL statement -- replace jar from remote location CALL SQLJ.REPLACE_JAR('http://www.example.com/tours.jar', 'APP.Sample2')
